meanings.definition: To put an end to; crush
meanings.sent1: She scotches the rumors by providing evidence.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scotches any doubts by explaining clearly.
meanings.sent3: The cat scotches the mouse's escape plan by sitting on the hole.
meanings.sent4: His determination scotches any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The bright light scotches the darkness in the room.

meanings.sent1: The fence scotches the dog from entering the garden.
meanings.sent2: They scotches any attempts to cheat in the game.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella scotches the rain from soaking her clothes.
meanings.sent4: The dam scotches the flow of the river.
meanings.sent5: The barrier scotches the intruders from entering the premises.

meanings.definition: A type of whiskey, typically made in Scotland
meanings.sent1: He enjoys a glass of scotches in the evening.
meanings.sent2: The bar offers a variety of scotches for the customers.
meanings.sent3: The scotches on the shelf beckon to be tasted.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of scotches fills the room.
meanings.sent5: The scotches from different distilleries have unique flavors.
